Loading required packages
```{r}
require("png")
require("parallel")

str(vg <- readPNG("Van_Gogh.png"))
dim(vg)

red.vg <- vg[,,1]
green.vg <- vg[,,2]
blue.vg <- vg[,,3]
str(blue.vg)

layout(matrix(1:3, ncol=3))
image(t(red.vg[nrow(red.vg):1,]), col = gray((1:12)/13), main="Red channel")
image(t(green.vg[nrow(green.vg):1,]), col = gray((1:12)/13), main="Green channel")
image(t(blue.vg[nrow(blue.vg):1,]), col = gray((1:12)/13), main="Blue channel")
```

Filtering function
```{r}
par.chan.filtering <- function(x, k = 1) {
  dim.x <- dim(x)
  pad.X <- matrix(0, (dim.x[1]+2*k), (dim.x[2]+2*k))
  pad.X[(k+1):(dim.x[1]+k), (k+1):(dim.x[2]+k)] <- x
  filtered.mat <- matrix(0, dim.x[1], dim.x[2])
  for(i in 2:((dim(pad.X)[1]) - 1)) {
    for(j in 2:((dim(pad.X)[2]) - 1)) {
      filtered.mat[i-1, j-1] <- ((pad.X[i-1, j-1] + pad.X[i-1, j] + pad.X[i-1, j+1] + pad.X[i, j-1] + pad.X[i, j] + pad.X[i, j+1] + pad.X[i+1, j-1] + pad.X[i+1, j] + pad.X[i+1, j+1])/9)
    }
  }
  return(filtered.mat)
}
```

Implementing function on Madison.png using 3 cores
```{r}
n.cores <- detectCores()
cluster <- makePSOCKcluster(names=n.cores)
clusterEvalQ(cl = cluster)
apply(red.vg, MARGIN = c(1,2),FUN = par.chan.filtering)
```
